intro: Billardiera daphnoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and typically grows on the branches of eucalyptus and other host trees. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its flowers are usually white or pale green. It produces small, fleshy berries that are an important food source for native birds. Billardiera daphnoides plays a significant ecological role in its habitat by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
